title: Reinstalling League, Client itself is not downloading correctly.
body:
I wasn't able to patch recently so I decided to do a full reinstall of league, as it doesn't take long and I thought it would fix the errors.  The patcher doesn't complete the client install.  I've tried a lot of things but I'm really stumped on this one.

LoLPatcherUx gives me a repeating error log, so I think whatever's stuck is related to it.

Text of the log file:

000000.000| ALWAYS| Logging started at 2016-07-12T16:44:07.982
000000.000| ALWAYS| Global logging level set to   OKAY
000000.000| ALWAYS| Log file C:/Riot Games/League of Legends/Logs/Patcher Logs/2016-07-12T16-44-07_LoLPatcherUx.log
000000.000| ALWAYS| Running LoLPatcherUx version 0.45.0.101
000000.000|   OKAY| Initial working directory: "C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\RADS\projects\lol_patcher\releases\0.0.0.62\deploy"
000000.000|   OKAY| Current process: "C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\RADS\projects\lol_patcher\releases\0.0.0.62\deploy\LoLPatcherUx.exe"
000000.000|   OKAY| Command line arguments:
	
	--force-device-scale-factor=1
	--use-http
	--remoting-auth-token=c6baa9ede9f630c0
	--app-port=52381
	--install-directory=C:/Riot Games/League of Legends/
	--app-name=LoLPatcher
	--ux-name=LoLPatcherUx
	--ux-helper-name=
	--log-dir=Patcher Logs
	--bugsplat-name=
	--project=
	--disable-spell-checking
	--no-displaying-insecure-content
000000.003|   OKAY| Riot::RADS::Reader::RadsMain::Initialize: RADS library initializing with specified working directory "C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\RADS\projects\lol_patcher\releases\0.0.0.62\deploy".
000000.004|   OKAY| Riot::RADS::Reader::RuntimeEnvironment::Create: Creating RADS runtime environment: RADS root directory = "C:/Riot Games/League of Legends/RADS"
000000.004|   OKAY| Riot::RADS::Reader::ReleaseManifest::LoadInternal: ("C:/Riot Games/League of Legends/RADS/projects/lol_patcher/releases/0.0.0.62/releasemanifest")
000000.045|   OKAY| Creating browser process.
000000.046| ALWAYS| App file system path is: C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\RADS\projects\lol_patcher\releases\0.0.0.62\deploy\
000000.046| ALWAYS| Plugins relative path is: Plugins\
000000.046| ALWAYS| Plugins file system path is: C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\RADS\projects\lol_patcher\releases\0.0.0.62\deploy\Plugins\
000000.046| ALWAYS| Plugins file system path is not an override.
000000.046|   OKAY| Loadable Memory Usage:
000000.046|   OKAY|  Total Mem Used: 0 KB
000000.052|  ERROR| ClientWebSocketTransport: Error receiving data. recv returned: 0
000000.052|  ERROR| ClientWebSocketTransport: Error receiving data. select returned: 10038
000000.052|  ERROR| ClientWebSocketTransport: Error receiving data. select returned: 10038
000000.052|  ERROR| ClientWebSocketTransport: Error receiving data. select returned: 10038
000000.052|  ERROR| ClientWebSocketTransport: Error receiving data. select returned: 10038
000000.052|  ERROR| ClientWebSocketTransport: Error receiving data. select returned: 10038
000000.052|  ERROR| ClientWebSocketTransport: Error receiving data. select returned: 10038
000000.052|  ERROR| ClientWebSocketTransport: Error receiving data. select returned: 10038

That error message will keep repeating until my hard drive fills.  It got to 40 gigs once. {{sticker:zombie-brand-facepalm}}

replies.body:
Alright going to detail what I'm doing.

Step one- Permissions

Windows 10, fully updated.
UAC, disabled (i dont like doing this, but...)
been running as admin the whole time, nothing new here.
Scandisk link is broken in that guide, and doesn't seem to exist in win10? I ran chkdsk in cmd as admin since that was the closest thing I could find, result said no errors.
Every reinstall I've tried (four or five now) has been as admin.

Step two- Heimy's Workshop
(note, i think it has something to do with the patcher so this seems promising?)

Patcher isn't invisible, skipping that.
Reset Winsock as admin. (I had done this before.)
Yes I'm running things as admin.
I cannot force a repatch as the install has never reached the point where the lol_air_client folder is created.
No game to run repair tool on.
Yep, UAC disabled still.
Disabled firewall.
It isn't letting me install dotnetfx35setup and the file was apparently for vista or older computers so I'm not sure what to do with that or why that version of the install is what's recommended by the workshop.
Not using wireless.  Have a strong wired connection and no issues with any other program, some of them very connection reliant.

Restarted my computer at this point to finalize windows updates and winsock reset.  Same exact error process.  Tried disabling antivirus completely just in case. Same errors. Turned anti-virus and firewall back on because it didn't help and I'm not crazy.

If it is the .net thing, I have no idea how to fix that.  That's the only thing that I couldn't get to work properly.

Step three- Connectivity

Servers are up!
Have a wired connection.
Tried firewall stuff already.  Using Kaspersky and League is clearly whitelisted.
Guys I hate to be upset here but these instructions are **VERY OUT OF DATE**.  No instructions for DNS for Win10.
Netalyzer is running now, gonna have to wait for that to finish.
Port Forwarding I need to wait for husband to get home since he has the router password.  I suppose this could be it, though it has never been a problem before.
Not on a restricted network.
Not on a VPN.
No instructions for DNS flush/Renew IP on win10.  I'm hesitant to do this anyways in case it messes up my permissions for other programs...

Step four- Hextech repair tool

Checked reinstall/clean uninstall.
Completed uninstall, reinstall starts.
Get to the 'launch lol' prompt.
LoL shield shows up, loading bar gets to about 75%
Vanishes without completing, starts the infinite error log.

Still not fixed.

I'm going to wait for the router password and see if that's the issue, if not I'll send the .zip over. :(

This could stem from a series of issues. I'd like you to uninstall League and delete any leftover files (if there are any) and follow the following guides;

[Grant League permission to run on your computer!](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204134104-Setting-up-your-Permissions)

http://ddragon.leagueoflegends.com/cdn/img/champion/splash/Annie_3.jpg


[Visit Heimy’s Workshop to patch these issues.](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/202969434-Patching-Issues)


http://vignette3.wikia.nocookie.net/leagueoflegends/images/c/c5/Heimerdinger_PiltoverCustomsSkin_old.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20120118075912



[Troubleshoot your connectivity issues.](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues)

http://na.leagueoflegends.com/sites/default/files/styles/scale_xlarge/public/upload/su16_keyart_1920x1080_0.jpg?itok=6nj8mHjj

---

If none of the above worked;

It's possible that you need to complete a clean reinstallation of League in order to resolve the issue. Grab Riot's [Hextech Repair Tool](https://s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/player-support/tools/Hextech%20Repair%20Tool.msi) and check both the box for 'Reinstall' and 'Clean Uninstall', then hit the Start button. This will wipe all files associated with League to ensure corruption doesn't carry over, then reinstalls the game.

Let us know if your issue is resolved or not.

(Credits to Targon's Blade for the last step)
